intro: Hyphear delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's hyphear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, palmate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has smooth, glossy foliage and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
